file_content.text: I'll talk to you later, Lieutenant. This cleanup is going to take a while.
Don't worry, Lieutenant. We'll take good care of our honorable guest, here.
Well, look what we've got here, boys. Welcome to safety, Senator.
Who in blazes are you? Mercenaries? This is ridiculous!
Oh, yeah. General Garza hires mercs to rescue Republic Senators all the time.
This is a Senator of the Republic, Sergeant. Show some respect.
Lose the attitude, Jaxo.
Sorry, Lieutenant.
These people are SpecForce troops in disguise, sir.
You'll be fine, Senator.
Fantastic. Now I almost wish they were mercenaries.
Poor, dumb politician.
By all means, continue insulting me, Lieutenant. Just wait until I return to the Senate.
So, you rescued our charming friend here, obviously. Nice work. Any luck taking down Wraith?
She fled the scene before I could confront her.
Unfortunately, no.
Rescuing the Senator tipped her off--she ran for it.
It was her or Krasul.
She got away while I was busy rescuing this jerk.
Don't even get me started.
Heh. Not sure you got a fair trade on that one, buddy.
Wraith must be even better than they say. We were watching every inch of this place--nobody saw her leave.
Is someone going to get me on a ship to Coruscant anytime soon?
Oh, don't worry, Your Honorable Eminent Senatorness. You're catching a ride with us.
Thanks for taking care of everything, Sergeant.
Much obliged.
No problem at all.
I owe you big time, Jaxo.
You're the best.
Hey, happy to help. Garza doesn't want you wasting time running a taxi service, anyway.
I'm sure we'll think of some way for you to make it up to me.
If Krasul doesn't play nice, you can leave him here.
Don't let him boss you around.
Nah. Leaving the guy to get jumped for his organs would be a waste of all your effort.
Besides, we're going to have a fun time together, aren't we, Senator?
Yes. Delightful.
Hey--I know you need to contact Garza and report in, but you should come back by my place on Coruscant sometime soon.
We'll have a little victory celebration--just the two of us. What do you say?
Count me in.
I'd like that.
Good deal.
A celebration might not be in the cards right now.
We'll see.
If anybody can make it happen, it's you.
Just don't keep me waiting too long. Garza's bound to send me on another op sooner or later. Wouldn't want to miss our chance.
So long--take care out there.
Not going to happen, Sergeant.
No.
Aww, you're no fun. Suit yourself.
Garza will want to hear from you ASAP, and we've got a ship to catch. Take care of yourself, okay?
You too, Jaxo.
You too, Jaxo.
Hopefully we can work together again soon.
It's been fun.
Count me in, Lieutenant.
Yeah, me too, Lieutenant.
Me too, my man. Me too.
Taking care of myself is what I do best.
You know I will.
Keep it up, then.
So long.
I don't know, I can think of some other things you're pretty good at, too.
We had scopes on that warehouse from every direction--nobody saw Wraith slip out. She must be even better than they say.
Lieutenant! We heard the explosion--what happened? Is Senator Krasul alright?
Unfortunately, Wraith killed the Senator before I could stop her.
Wraith got him.
Ouch. Hey, I'm sure there was nothing you could've done, Lieutenant.
Rescuing Krasul would have compromised my mission.
I had to let him die.
I thought rescuing Krasul was your mission.
The Senator gave his life so that I could catch Wraith.
[Lie] He sacrificed himself.
You kidding me? Doesn't sound like the Krasul I've heard about. He must have really hated her.
Did you have any luck taking down Wraith? Come on, tell me we got something out of all this.
Target neutralized, Sergeant.
That's affirmative.
I lost a Senator today. Taking Wraith down doesn't make up for that.
Getting her wasn't worth it.
You shouldn't beat yourself up, Lieutenant--getting Wraith has to be pretty major.
Wraith got the traitor's death she deserved.
I made her pay.
That's something. Galaxy's bound to be a safer place without her in it.
We'll handle the cleanup here. But, hey--you should come by my place on Coruscant sometime soon. You know... take some time to relax?
I'll come by as soon as I can.
I'd like that.
I'll be looking forward to it.
It might not be possible.
We'll see.
You're the big shot Havoc commander. Make it happen.
Don't keep me waiting too long, though, or Garza will send me out on another op. Wouldn't want to miss our chance.
All right, boys, let's go get this over with. See you soon, hon--take care out there.
It's not happening, Sergeant.
No.
Fine, fine. Suit yourself.
Look, we'll take care of the cleanup here. Garza will want your report ASAP.
I appreciate all of your help, Sergeant.
Thank you.
Oh, my pleasure.
I could lend a hand.
Sure you don't want me to stick around and help?
I could lend a hand.
No, no. Get back to saving the Republic, Lieutenant Hero. We'll take care of this.
Too bad I'll miss the fun.
Oh, yeah, I'm sure it breaks your heart to miss cleanup detail.
Come on, boys, let's see what bits of the late Senator we can find.
See you around, Lieutenant. Take care of yourself out there.
Say, I'd love to meet up. When will you be free?
[Flirt] Let's meet later?
Uh, well....
Unbelievable.
It won't happen again, Elara.
Oh--sorry.
Forget it--it's no business of mine, sir.
Sergeant Dorne, do you have something to say?
Come again?
No, sir, Lieutenant, sir. Nothing at all.
Don't worry, Elara, you can come, too!
Jealous, honey?
I... you... Lieutenant!
Listen--not this time, okay? You've got stuff to do, and I've never felt particularly romantic after a bombing cleanup.
Sorry, but I gotta take our friend here to Coruscant, then come back to smooth things over with some contacts.
I'll be in touch, though. Promise.
Uh, sorry. Call me crazy, but cleaning up bomb victims doesn't put me in a romantic kind of mood.
Some other time, though. Promise.
Let's move, Lieutenant. Krasul isn't going to get himself out of there.
Hey, hey, my number-one sister-in-arms! Good to see you again, Lieutenant.
Hope you're ready to crack some skulls, because you've really got your work cut out for you on this one.
What do we have here, Sergeant?
Give me a sitrep.
A real good time in the making, that's what we've got here.
I like a challenge.
I've heard. You're starting to build up quite a rep--I'm getting a little jealous, here.
Are you ever going to learn to salute, Jaxo?
Show me some respect.
Sorry, Lieutenant, the deep cover habits die hard. Sir.
Well, if it isn't the man himself. I was hoping Garza would send you to handle this one.
I'd have preferred getting together somewhere a bit more private than a hostage situation, but this will just have to do.
Give me a sitrep, Sergeant.
Tell me what you've learned.
I'm sure we can find a way to get alone together sooner or later.
[Flirt] Next time.
I'd like that very much.
Skip the come-ons and give me the situation here.
Stick to the op.
Sure, play coy. You don't know what you're missing.
Let's start with the accommodations. Port Raga is privately owned and officially neutral, but Wraith and her pals have taken over behind the scenes.
My boys and I managed to tweak the sensors and keep your landing inconspicuous. But as soon as you step out of this hangar, it's party time.
Do you know where Krasul is being held?
Any intel on the Senator?
We do, but there's some bad news on that front.
How many am I up against?
Tell me about the opposition.
We couldn't get a solid count without giving ourselves away. Somewhere between "a lot" and "a whole lot"--all Imperial.
All you did was clear my landing?
You could've done more.
Well, we also found the Senator for you. It's not a pretty scene, though.
Wraith has Krasul locked up in a hangar at the other end of the station. There's heavy security plus a big bonus: explosives.
Not enough "bang" to trash the station, of course, but plenty to ruin your day if you're in that hangar when they blow. Play it careful in there.
Thanks for the heads up, Sergeant.
Understood.
You got it.
Are you bringing your team in with us, Sergeant?
Are you backing us up?
Will you and your team be going in with me?
Are you backing me up?
I'd love to, but Garza's orders were pretty clear: Havoc goes in alone. We'll get your back if things go bad, though.
I'll make my own tactical assessments, Sergeant.
Skip the advice.
Suit yourself, hot shot.
I'd say it's time to get out there and get our Senator back. What do you say?
Havoc Squad, move out!
Let's do it.
It's about time.
Let's do it.
Get ready to be impressed.
I'm looking forward to it.
I'll make the decisions here, Sergeant.
I'd say it's not up to you.
Guess I'll take that as a yes, then.
See you on the other side, Lieutenant. Good luck.
Lieutenant.
Get lost, would you?
